as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="L2iQRGnF9VsD0ROrTpiG-21" value="<font style="font-size: 22px;">Networking is common in Linux,AWS,Docker and K8s</font>" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="L2iQRGnF9VsD0ROrTpiG-22" value="<font style="font-size: 20px;">File Storage in Linux called as NFS in aws we have EFS, Same way you can mount EFS to multiple style="font-size: 32px;">2. 3-tier single page application[spa.konkas.tech ---&gt; CloudFront ---&gt; S3 ---&gt; ALB ---&gt; ECS ---&gt; RDS]</font></span><div><span style="background-color: initial;"><br></span></div>" style="text;html=1;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;resizable=0;points=[];autosize=1;strokeColor=#10739e;fillColor=#b1ddf0;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="260" y="1285" width="1450" height="70" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="L2iQRGnF9VsD0ROrTpiG-29" value="<font style="font-size: 32px;">3. Dockerizing 3-tier application and Roboshop</font>" style="text;html=1;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;resizable=0;points=[];autosize=1;strokeColor=#10739e;fillColor=#b1ddf0;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="260" y="1350" width="690" height="50" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="L2iQRGnF9VsD0ROrTpiG-31" value="<span style="font-size: 32px;">4. Deploy RoboShop On ECS Cluster</span>" style="text;html=1;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;resizable=0;points=[];autosize=1;strokeColor=#10739e;fillColor=#b1ddf0;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="260" y="1400" width="560" height="50" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="L2iQRGnF9VsD0ROrTpiG-33" value="<font style="font-size: 32px;">5. Deploy 3-tier app and Roboshop in EKS CLuster</font>" style="text;html=1;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;resizable=0;points=[];autosize=1;strokeColor=#10739e;fillColor=#b1ddf0;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="260" y="1460" width="750" height="50" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="L2iQRGnF9VsD0ROrTpiG-34" value="<div><span style="font-size: 32px;">6. Using GithubActions Create CI/CD pipeline to deploy RoboShop on ECS</span></div><div><br></div>" style="text;html=1;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;resizable=0;points=[];autosize=1;strokeColor=#10739e;fillColor=#b1ddf0;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="260" y="1510" width="1090" height="70" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="L2iQRGnF9VsD0ROrTpiG-35" value="<div><span style="font-size: 32px;">7. Create CI Jenkins Pipelines to build image Use ArgoCD to Rollout application Deployment on EKS[Only for RoboShop]</span></div><div><br></div>" style="text;html=1;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;resizable=0;points=[];autosize=1;strokeColor=#10739e;fillColor=#b1ddf0;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="260" y="1570" width="1740" height="70" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="L2iQRGnF9VsD0ROrTpiG-38" value="<font style="font-size: 32px;">In the IT industry, nearly 80% of challenges arise from networking complexities, while the remaining 20% are attributed to misconfigurations,&nbsp;</font><div><font style="font-size: 32px;">including application issues, storage errors, CI/CD pipeline faults, and resource mismanagement</font></div>" style="text;html=1;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;resizable=0;points=[];autosize=1;strokeColor=#10739e;fillColor=#b1ddf0;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="-40" y="1760" width="2010" height="90" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="L2iQRGnF9VsD0ROrTpiG-39" value="<span style="font-size: 20px;">In General Block Storage was used to install OS</span>" style="text;html=1;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;resizable=0;points=[];autosize=1;strokeColor=#10739e;fillColor=#b1ddf0;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="-120" y="760" width="450" height="40" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="L2iQRGnF9VsD0ROrTpiG-40" value="<p><br></p>" style="text;html=1;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;resizable=0;points=[];autosize=1;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="865" y="805" width="20" height="50" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="L2iQRGnF9VsD0ROrTpiG-41" value="<font style="font-size: 17px;">Block storage is used to store data for fast I/O operations, high throughput, and low latency.</font>" style="text;html=1;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;resizable=0;points=[];autosize=1;strokeColor=#0e8088;fillColor=#b0e3e6;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="-40" y="840" width="710" height="30" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="L2iQRGnF9VsD0ROrTpiG-42" value="<font style="forced-color-adjust: none; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Helvetica; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: center; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: nowrap; background-color: rgb(251, 251, 251); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial; font-size: 20px;">&nbsp;</font><div style="forced-color-adjust: none; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: center; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: nowrap; background-color: rgb(251, 251, 251); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;"><font style="forced-color-adjust: none; font-size: 20px;">Docker has volume concept and k8s also have volumes concept like pv</font></div>" style="text;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;fillColor=#b0e3e6;strokeColor=#0e8088;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="610" y="870" width="650" height="70" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="NVxrgasR2bD2G7ITdtOz-2" value="In every Linux OS, the <strong>kernel</strong> is the key component. It provides critical features like <strong>namespaces</strong> and <strong>cGroups</strong>." style="text;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="950" y="590" width="610" height="50" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="NVxrgasR2bD2G7ITdtOz-3" value="<strong>Namespaces</strong> play a crucial role in containerization by enabling containers to behave as isolated individual entities. Each container gets its own network stack, filesystem, user space, DNS, and other resources.&nbsp;<div>This isolation allows containers to operate independently while sharing the same underlying kernel.</div>" style="text;html=1;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;resizable=0;points=[];autosize=1;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="940" y="625" width="1140" height="40" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="NVxrgasR2bD2G7ITdtOz-4" value="In Kubernetes (k8s), every <strong>pod</strong> gets a <strong>unique IP address</strong>. This is made possible by a special container called the <strong>pause container</strong>, which acts as the parent container for all containers within the pod.&nbsp;<div>When a pod is created, all the containers within the pod are attached to the network namespace of the pause container.</div>" style="text;html=1;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;resizable=0;points=[];autosize=1;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="940" y="680" width="1090" height="40" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="NVxrgasR2bD2G7ITdtOz-5" value="As a result, all containers inside the pod can seamlessly communicate with each other via <strong>localhost</strong>. The pause container essentially provides a common network namespace,&nbsp;<div>ensuring inter-container communication within the pod without requiring additional networking configurations.</div>" style="text;html=1;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;resizable=0;points=[];autosize=1;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="940" y="730" width="960" height="40" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="NVxrgasR2bD2G7ITdtOz-6" value="This setup highlights how Kubernetes leverages Linux namespaces to achieve pod-level isolation and efficient communication." style="text;html=1;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;resizable=0;points=[];autosize=1;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="940" y="775" width="690" height="30" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> </root> </mxGraphModel> </diagram> </mxfile>

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 608px; height: 1px; padding-top: 917px; margin-left: 1162px;

div.div: In every Linux OS, the kernel is the key component. It provides critical features like namespaces and cGroups.

switch.text: In every Linux OS, the kernel is the key component. It provides critical features like namespaces and...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 965px; margin-left: 1720px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;

div.div:
Namespaces play a crucial role in containerization by enabling containers to behave as isolated individual entities. Each container gets its own network stack, filesystem, user space, DNS, and other resources.
This isolation allows containers to operate independently while sharing the same underlying kernel.

switch.text: Namespaces play a crucial role in containerization by enabling containers to behave as isolated individual entities. Each container gets its own network stack, filesystem, user space, DNS, a...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1020px; margin-left: 1695px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;

div.div:
In Kubernetes (k8s), every pod gets a unique IP address. This is made possible by a special container called the pause container, which acts as the parent container for all containers within the pod.
When a pod is created, all the containers within the pod are attached to the network namespace of the pause container.

switch.text: In Kubernetes (k8s), every pod gets a unique IP address. This is made possible by a special container called the pause container, which acts as the parent container for all containe...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1070px; margin-left: 1630px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;

div.div:
As a result, all containers inside the pod can seamlessly communicate with each other via localhost. The pause container essentially provides a common network namespace,
ensuring inter-container communication within the pod without requiring additional networking configurations.

switch.text: As a result, all containers inside the pod can seamlessly communicate with each other via localhost. The pause container essentially provides a common network n...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1110px; margin-left: 1495px;

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;

div.div: This setup highlights how Kubernetes leverages Linux namespaces to achieve pod-level isolation and efficient communication.
